marketNews.title: Danantara Will Invest US$10 Billion Until End of 2025
marketNews.content:
Chief Investment Officer of Danantara, Pandu Sjahrir, told Reuters on Thursday (02/10) that the firm will invest around US$10 billion or approximately IDR 165 trillion in the first three months of its operations starting in October 2025. Eighty percent of the funds will be allocated to domestic investments, while the remaining twenty percent will be used for overseas investments.

Pandu explained that the initial projects to be financed by Danantara include a Hajj village in Saudi Arabia, an upstream energy project with Pertamina, and a waste-to-energy power plant, with several projects expected to start operating by the end of this year. Previously, Danantara CEO Rosan Roeslani said on Tuesday (30/9) that the company will launch 33 waste-to-energy projects (PSEL), of which eight projects will be launched at the end of October 2025.

Pandu added that Danantara also aims to increase liquidity in the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IHSG), reaffirming his statement in April 2025 when he mentioned that Danantara is ready to become a liquidity provider for the Indonesian stock market.

Over the next two years, Pandu said Danantara will focus on energy security, food security, renewable energy, financial services, healthcare, real estate, and digital infrastructure. Stockbit previously wrote about several potential Danantara investments.

Danantara has obtained financing from various sources, namely: 1) dividends from state-owned enterprises estimated at US$7 billion or about IDR 116 trillion during 2025; 2) issuance of patriot bonds worth IDR 50 trillion for the energy transition sector and others; and 3) multi-currency loans up to US$10 billion or about IDR 165 trillion.

Key Takeaway

Among the disclosed investment plans, only Garuda Indonesia ($GIAA) has so far received investment from Danantara through a shareholder loan of US$405 million or roughly IDR 6.7 trillion, which is planned to be followed by a capital contribution. In addition, Krakatau Steel ($KRAS) has requested Danantara to inject capital of US$500 million or about IDR 8.3 trillion – also in the form of a shareholder loan – which is expected to be executed before the end of 2025.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need to Know
marketNews.content:
Reuters reported that the National Nuclear Agency is still determining the extent of radioactive contamination by Caesium-137, with ten hotspots identified in the Cikande Modern Industrial Zone. Spokesperson Bara Hasibuan said the agency hopes to know the total contaminated area by early next week. The contamination was first detected in shrimp shipments to the United States in August 2025 from a local company based in the Cikande zone. After thorough scanning, the government said the source is an old iron plant named PT Peter Metal Technology. The Cikande Modern Industrial Zone covers 3,175 hectares and hosts more than 270 companies ranging from food processing to automotive components.

The Ministry of Communication and Digital temporarily froze the electronic system provider (TDPSE) registration for TikTok Pte. Ltd. after the company refused to share complete live-streaming data during the national demonstrations at the end of August 2025. TDPSE is the operating license for electronic system providers. The impact of the temporary freeze on TikTok's operations in Indonesia remains unknown.

Trade Minister Budi Santoso urged the European Union to remove countervailing duties on certain Indonesian stainless-steel imports. The request follows a World Trade Organization statement on Thursday (02/10) that the EU measures are inconsistent with agreed-upon rules.

Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa announced plans to develop a tobacco-industry zone to encourage illegal cigarette manufacturers to become legal. The government will discuss with current operators to determine the most appropriate and fair excise tariff mechanism. While the government offers training and empowerment, it stresses that sanctions will be applied to firms that fail to meet tax obligations.

Alam Sutera Realty controller ($ASRI), PT Manunggal Prime Development, was recorded buying approximately 147.85 million ASRI shares. The transaction, reported in KSEI data on 1 October 2025, did not disclose the transaction value. After the purchase, PT Manunggal Prime Development's ownership in ASRI increased from 26.12% to 26.87%.

marketNews.title: Green Energy: Indonesia's Basic Future Need
marketNews.content: "Green energy transition in Indonesia is no longer a choice, but a necessity." – husin1030

tickerNews.title: ASII Announces Interim Dividend with Approximate Yield 1.7%
tickerNews.content: Astra International ($ASII) plans to distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2025 amounting to roughly IDR 4 trillion or IDR 98 per share, indicating a dividend yield of about 1.7% as of Friday (03/10). The dividend will be cum-dividend in the regular market and in negotiations on 13 October 2025, with payment scheduled for 31 October 2025.

tickerNews.title: HRUM Announces Share Buyback Up to 5.56%
tickerNews.content: Harum Energy ($HRUM) intends to carry out a share buyback of up to 5.56% with a funding allocation of up to IDR 837 billion for the period 6 October 2025 to 2 January 2026. The plan does not require shareholder meeting approval, following the relaxation granted by OJK to support market stability.

tickerNews.title: PNGO Announces Interim Dividend with Approximate Yield 4.3%
tickerNews.content: Pinago Utama ($PNGO) plans to distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2025 amounting to roughly IDR 101.6 billion or IDR 130 per share, indicating a dividend yield of about 4.3% as of Friday (03/10). The dividend will be cum-dividend in the regular market and in negotiations on 10 October 2025, with payment scheduled for 24 October 2025.

tickerNews.title: ERAL Reports Near 1,000 Vehicle Orders for Xpeng Models
tickerNews.content: Sinar Eka Selaras ($ERAL) reported nearly 1,000 vehicle order letters (SPK) for two Xpeng electric car models up to September 2025, representing 67-100% of the 2025 target range of 1,000-1,500 units. Previously, ERAL signed a partnership to become the official distributor and sole agent for the Xpeng brand since the end of 2024 and started local assembly in Purwakarta, West Java, in July 2025.

tickerNews.title: TLDN Announces Interim Dividend with Approximate Yield 2.2%
tickerNews.content: Teladan Prima Agro ($TLDN) plans to distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2025 amounting to roughly IDR 200.7 billion or IDR 15.5 per share, indicating a dividend yield of about 2.2% as of Friday (03/10). The dividend will be cum-dividend in the regular market and in negotiations on 13 October 2025, with payment scheduled for 23 October 2025.
